summary: This is a service request log from August 15, 2019, detailing a priority upgrade and installation of a Nice Vision surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It indicates work was ongoing and training for a Comm Tech named Daniel was scheduled.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned to the service request for installing a Nice Vision system at the MCC New York. Scheduled to work on the project from August 12-16, 2019.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Assigned to the service request and noted as being on-site installing the Nice Vision system at the MCC New York.

persons.name: Daniel
persons.context: A communications technician at the MCC New York who was scheduled to receive training on the newly installed Nice Vision system.

events.title: Service Request for MCC Surveillance Upgrade
events.description: A priority service request was created for the installation and upgrade of a Nice Vision surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Installation Work Period
events.description: Scheduled work period for technicians to install and program the new Nice Vision surveillance system at the MCC.

events.title: Scheduled Training for Comm Tech
events.description: Training was scheduled for Comm Tech Daniel on the newly installed Phase 1 of the surveillance system.

keyFacts: This document is a service request log for upgrading a surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in August 2019.
The work involved installing a 'Nice Vision' system with servers, decoders, encoders, and programming for approximately 161 cameras.
The request was marked as a priority (P3 Next Day) and an emergency, indicating urgent need for the system upgrade.
The document provides a specific address (150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007) for the MCC, a facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
